text: I'm relatively new to deep learning and I am working on the GTZAN audio dataset for practice, split into train/val/test. I am attempting 1D conv nets but my validation accuracy remains around 30% with the following architecture. The data set is 655001 (~30 s) of audio. How do you exactly systematically go about building a CNN? Even without neural nets, I was able to get around 70% accuracy with just semi-classical method of FFT->log transform->PCA of untransformed FFT take 100, PCA of log take first 20 ->concat these and random forest. And I am thinking neural nets have got to do better on audio data than a semi-classical method so I must be doing something wrong

text: 30s of audio sounds like several orders of magnitude too little for deep learning
